title: Lumen — Brand Identity & Digital Style System

frames.text: Lumen is a sustainability-focused lifestyle startup that creates eco-friendly home products for urban millennials. Scope: develop a complete brand identity system, including logo redesign, typography, color system, brand guidelines, applications across packaging, website, and social media, plus a digital style guide.
frames.note: Use a clean banner or title card here.

frames.text: Lumen launched quickly with a DIY logo and inconsistent visual style. The brand struggled with an outdated logo, inconsistent typography and color palette across digital and physical touchpoints, and weak differentiation in a crowded eco-lifestyle market.
frames.note: Show old logo or placeholder comparison.

frames.text: Market research revealed that competitors leaned heavily on green tones and nature motifs, creating visual sameness. Successful eco-brands balanced minimalism with warmth.
frames.note: Collage of personas, competitor brands, and moodboard.

frames.text: 1. Modernize identity to feel premium yet approachable. 2. Establish a cohesive system adaptable across digital and physical assets. 3. Differentiate from green-heavy branding clichés. 4. Create scalable guidelines for web, packaging, and social channels.
frames.note: Use icon set or simple graphic to show 4 goals.

frames.text: Logo development explored wordmark concepts emphasizing clarity and geometry. Final design: a clean sans-serif logotype with a circular accent symbolizing renewal and cycles of sustainability.
frames.note: Include logo sketches, typography system, and palette graphic.

frames.text: Applied the system across packaging, website, and social. Packaging: minimal layouts with terracotta accents for hierarchy. Website: clean grid, editorial typography, lifestyle photography.
frames.note: Show packaging mockup, website screens, and Instagram grid.

frames.text: Final outputs included the logo system (primary, icon, monochrome), typography and color guidelines, full brand guidelines PDF, packaging mockups, website homepage and product page.
frames.note: Hero-style montage of all deliverables.

frames.text: Projected brand recognition increase: +40% through consistent, distinct visuals. Website redesign estimated to improve clarity of product categories and reduce bounce rate by 25–30%.
frames.note: Add metrics graphics and testimonial card.

frames.text: This project reinforced the importance of balancing strategy with aesthetics—avoiding clichés while still signaling sustainability. With more time, I would extend the system into motion design for social reels and product demo videos.
frames.note: Keep this minimal with a soft visual background.

frames.text: FixOFF is an experimental entertainment collective producing genre-blending music. The project scope included a full AI-driven rebrand: brand identity, website concept, mobile music app UI, and packaging/social visuals.

frames.text: FixOFF's existing branding was minimal and generic, making it difficult to stand out in the crowded digital music space. Their outdated website lacked interactivity, and they struggled to resonate with AI-native younger audiences.

frames.text: User personas highlighted Gen Z listeners seeking immersive aesthetics and indie creators resonating with experimental visuals. Surveys showed demand for authenticity and uniqueness.

title: Aurora Tea Co. – Digital Content Campaign
